com.topcoder.commons.utils
类 ValidationUtility

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.commons.utils.ValidationUtility

public class ValidationUtility
extends java.lang.Object

This is a utility class that provides static methods for checking whether some arbitrary value meets specific criteria (not null, not empty, positive, negative, etc). If criteria is not met, this utility throws an exception of type specified by the caller. Thread Safety: This class is immutable and thread safe when collection parameters passed to it are used by the caller in thread safe manner.

从以下版本开始：
1.0.0
版本：
1.0.0
作者：
Frogcherry 周晓龙 frogcherry@gmail.com

方法详细信息

checkNotNull

public static <T extends java.lang.Throwable> void checkNotNull(java.lang.Object value,
                                                                java.lang.String name,
                                                                java.lang.Class<T> exceptionClass)
                         throws T extends java.lang.Throwable
Checks whether the given value is not null. And if this condition is not met, the specified exception is thrown. Generic Parameters: T - the type of the exception to be thrown when validation fails Parameters: value - the value to be checked name - the name associated with the value exceptionClass - the exception class Throws: T if the given value is null Implementation Notes: 1. If value == null then 1.1. Throw ExceptionHelper.constructException(exceptionClass, name + " should not be null");

参数：
exceptionClass - the exception class
name - the name associated with the value
value - the value to be checked
抛出：
T - if the given value is null
T extends java.lang.Throwable

checkNotEmpty

public static <T extends java.lang.Throwable> void checkNotEmpty(java.lang.String value,
                                                                 java.lang.String name,
                                                                 java.lang.Class<T> exceptionClass)
                          throws T extends java.lang.Throwable
Checks whether the given string value is not empty (without trimming). And if this condition is not met, the specified exception is thrown. Note that if value is null, exception is not thrown. Generic Parameters: T - the type of the exception to be thrown when validation fails Parameters: value - the value to be checked name - the name associated with the value exceptionClass - the exception class Throws: T if the given value is empty Implementation Notes: 1. If value != null and value.equals("") then 1.1. Throw ExceptionHelper.constructException(exceptionClass, name + " should not be empty");

参数：
exceptionClass - the exception class
name - the name associated with the value
value - the value to be checked
抛出：
T - if the given value is empty
T extends java.lang.Throwable

                                 throws T extends java.lang.Throwable

Generic Parameters: T - the type of the exception to be thrown when validation fails Parameters: value - the value to be checked name - the name associated with the value exceptionClass - the exception class Throws: T if the given value is null or empty Implementation Notes: 1. checkNotNull(value, name, exceptionClass); 2. checkNotEmpty(value, name, exceptionClass);

参数：
exceptionClass - the exception class
name - the name associated with the value
value - the value to be checked

T - if the given value is null or empty

checkInstance

public static <T extends java.lang.Throwable> void checkInstance(java.lang.Object value,
                                                                 java.lang.Class<?> expectedType,
                                                                 java.lang.String name,
                                                                 java.lang.Class<T> exceptionClass)
                          throws T extends java.lang.Throwable
Checks whether the given value is an instance of the specified type. And if this condition is not met, the specified exception is thrown. Note that if value is null, exception is thrown. Generic Parameters: T - the type of the exception to be thrown when validation fails Parameters: value - the value to be checked expectedType - the expected type of the value name - the name associated with the value exceptionClass - the exception class Throws: T if the given value is not an instance of the expected type Implementation Notes: 1. If not expectedType.isInstance(value) then 1.1. Throw ExceptionHelper.constructException(exceptionClass, name + " should be an instance of " + expectedType.getName());

参数：
exceptionClass - the exception class
name - the name associated with the value
expectedType - the expected type of the value
value - the value to be checked
抛出：
T - if the given value is not an instance of the expected type
T extends java.lang.Throwable

checkNullOrInstance

public static <T extends java.lang.Throwable> void checkNullOrInstance(java.lang.Object value,
                                                                       java.lang.Class<?> expectedType,
                                                                       java.lang.String name,
                                                                       java.lang.Class<T> exceptionClass)
                                throws T extends java.lang.Throwable
Checks whether the given value is null or an instance of the specified type. And if this condition is not met, the specified exception is thrown. Generic Parameters: T - the type of the exception to be thrown when validation fails Parameters: value - the value to be checked expectedType - the expected type of the value name - the name associated with the value exceptionClass - the exception class Throws: T if the given value is not null and not an instance of the expected type Implementation Notes: 1. If value != null and not expectedType.isInstance(value) then 1.1. Throw ExceptionHelper.constructException(exceptionClass, name + " should be null or an instance of " + expectedType.getName());

参数：
exceptionClass - the exception class
name - the name associated with the value
expectedType - the expected type of the value
value - the value to be checked
抛出：
T - if the given value is not null and not an instance of the expected type
T extends java.lang.Throwable

checkExists

public static <T extends java.lang.Throwable> void checkExists(java.io.File file,
                                                               java.lang.String name,
                                                               java.lang.Class<T> exceptionClass)
                        throws T extends java.lang.Throwable
Checks whether the given File instance points to an existing file or directory. And if this condition is not met, the specified exception is thrown. Note that if file is null, exception is not thrown. Generic Parameters: T - the type of the exception to be thrown when validation fails Parameters: file - the File instance to be checked name - the name associated with the value exceptionClass - the exception class Throws: T if the given file value represents a not existing file or directory Implementation Notes: 1. If file != null and not file.exists() then 1.1. Throw ExceptionHelper.constructException(exceptionClass, name + " should point to an existing file or directory");

参数：
exceptionClass - the exception class
file - the File instance to be checked
name - the name associated with the value
抛出：
T - if the given file value represents a not existing file or directory
T extends java.lang.Throwable

checkNotNullElements

public static <T extends java.lang.Throwable> void checkNotNullElements(java.util.Collection<?> collection,
                                                                        java.lang.String name,
                                                                        java.lang.Class<T> exceptionClass)
                                 throws T extends java.lang.Throwable
Checks whether the given collection doesn't contain null elements. And if this condition is not met, the specified exception is thrown. Note that if collection is null, exception is not thrown. Generic Parameters: T - the type of the exception to be thrown when validation fails Parameters: collection - the collection to be checked name - the name associated with the value exceptionClass - the exception class Throws: T if the given collection contains null element Implementation Notes: 1. If collection == null then return; 2. boolean containsNull = false; 3. For each element:Object from collection do: 3.1. If element == null then 3.1.1. containsNull = true; 3.1.2. break; 4. If containsNull then 4.1. Throw ExceptionHelper.constructException(exceptionClass, name + " should not contain null");

参数：
exceptionClass - the exception class
name - the name associated with the value
collection - the collection to be checked
抛出：
T - if the given collection contains null element
T extends java.lang.Throwable

checkNotEmptyElements

public static <T extends java.lang.Throwable> void checkNotEmptyElements(java.util.Collection<?> collection,
                                                                         boolean trimStrings,
                                                                         java.lang.String name,
                                                                         java.lang.Class<T> exceptionClass)
                                  throws T extends java.lang.Throwable
Checks whether the given collection doesn't contain empty elements (strings, collections, maps). And if this condition is not met, the specified exception is thrown. Note that if collection is null, exception is not thrown. Generic Parameters: T - the type of the exception to be thrown when validation fails Parameters: collection - the collection to be checked trimStrings - true if strings should be trimmed before emptiness check, false otherwise name - the name associated with the value exceptionClass - the exception class Throws: T if the given collection contains an empty element (string, collection or map) Implementation Notes: 1. If collection == null then return; 2. boolean containsEmpty = false; 3. For each element:Object from collection do: 3.1. If element is an instance of String then 3.1.1. String str = (String) element; 3.1.2. If trimStrings then 3.1.2.1. str = str.trim(); 3.1.3. If str.equals("") then 3.1.3.1. containsEmpty = true; 3.1.3.2. break; 3.2. Else if element is an instance of Collection then 3.2.1. If ((Collection) element).isEmpty() then 3.2.1.1. containsEmpty = true; 3.2.1.2. break; 3.3. Else if element is an instance of Map then 3.3.1. If ((Collection) element).isEmpty() then 3.3.1.1. containsEmpty = true; 3.3.1.2. break; 4. If containsEmpty then 4.1. Throw ExceptionHelper.constructException(exceptionClass, name + " should not contain empty elements");

参数：
exceptionClass - the exception class
name - the name associated with the value
trimStrings - true if strings should be trimmed before emptiness check, false otherwise
collection - the collection to be checked
抛出：
T - if the given collection contains an empty element (string, collection or map)
T extends java.lang.Throwable

checkNotNullKeys

public static <T extends java.lang.Throwable> void checkNotNullKeys(java.util.Map<?,?> map,
                                                                    java.lang.String name,
                                                                    java.lang.Class<T> exceptionClass)
                             throws T extends java.lang.Throwable
Checks whether the given map doesn't contain a null key. And if this condition is not met, the specified exception is thrown. Note that if map is null, exception is not thrown. Generic Parameters: T - the type of the exception to be thrown when validation fails Parameters: map - the value to be checked name - the name associated with the value exceptionClass - the exception class Throws: T if the given map contains null key Implementation Notes: 1. If map != null and map.containsKey(null) then 1.1. Throw ExceptionHelper.constructException(exceptionClass, name + " should not contain null key");

参数：
exceptionClass - the exception class
name - the name associated with the value
map - the value to be checked
抛出：
T - if the given map contains null key
T extends java.lang.Throwable

checkNotNullValues

public static <T extends java.lang.Throwable> void checkNotNullValues(java.util.Map<?,?> map,
                                                                      java.lang.String name,
                                                                      java.lang.Class<T> exceptionClass)
                               throws T extends java.lang.Throwable
Checks whether the given map doesn't contain a null value. And if this condition is not met, the specified exception is thrown. Note that if map is null, exception is not thrown. Generic Parameters: T - the type of the exception to be thrown when validation fails Parameters: map - the map to be checked name - the name associated with the value exceptionClass - the exception class Throws: T if the given map contains null value Implementation Notes: 1. If map != null and map.containsValue(null) then 1.1. Throw ExceptionHelper.constructException(exceptionClass, name + " should not contain null value");

参数：
exceptionClass - the exception class
name - the name associated with the value
map - the map to be checked
抛出：
T - if the given map contains null value
T extends java.lang.Throwable

checkNotEmptyKeys

public static <T extends java.lang.Throwable> void checkNotEmptyKeys(java.util.Map<?,?> map,
                                                                     boolean trimStrings,
                                                                     java.lang.String name,
                                                                     java.lang.Class<T> exceptionClass)
                              throws T extends java.lang.Throwable
Checks whether the given map doesn't contain empty keys (strings, collection, maps). And if this condition is not met, the specified exception is thrown. Note that if map is null, exception is not thrown. Generic Parameters: T - the type of the exception to be thrown when validation fails Parameters: map - the map to be checked trimStrings - true if strings should be trimmed before emptiness check, false otherwise name - the name associated with the value exceptionClass - the exception class Throws: T if the given map contains an empty key (string, collection or map) Implementation Notes: 1. If map == null then return; 2. boolean containsEmpty = false; 3. For each key:Object from map.keySet() do: 3.1. If key is an instance of String then 3.1.1. String str = (String) key; 3.1.2. If trimStrings then 3.1.2.1. str = str.trim(); 3.1.3. If str.equals("") then 3.1.3.1. containsEmpty = true; 3.1.3.2. break; 3.2. Else if key is an instance of Collection then 3.2.1. If ((Collection) key).isEmpty() then 3.2.1.1. containsEmpty = true; 3.2.1.2. break; 3.3. Else if key is an instance of Map then 3.3.1. If ((Map) key).isEmpty() then 3.3.1.1. containsEmpty = true; 3.3.1.2. break; 4. If containsEmpty then 4.1. Throw ExceptionHelper.constructException(exceptionClass, name + " should not contain empty keys");

参数：
exceptionClass - the exception class
name - the name associated with the value
map - the map to be checked
trimStrings - true if strings should be trimmed before emptiness check, false otherwise
抛出：
T - if the given map contains an empty key (string, collection or map)
T extends java.lang.Throwable

checkNotEmptyValues

public static <T extends java.lang.Throwable> void checkNotEmptyValues(java.util.Map<?,?> map,
                                                                       boolean trimStrings,
                                                                       java.lang.String name,
                                                                       java.lang.Class<T> exceptionClass)
                                throws T extends java.lang.Throwable
Checks whether the given map doesn't contain empty values (strings, collection, maps). And if this condition is not met, the specified exception is thrown. Note that if map is null, exception is not thrown. Generic Parameters: T - the type of the exception to be thrown when validation fails Parameters: map - the map to be checked trimStrings - true if strings should be trimmed before emptiness check, false otherwise name - the name associated with the value exceptionClass - the exception class Throws: T if the given map contains an empty value (string, collection or map) Implementation Notes: 1. If map == null then return; 2. boolean containsEmpty = false; 3. For each value:Object from map.values() do: 3.1. If value is an instance of String then 3.1.1. String str = (String) value; 3.1.2. If trimStrings then 3.1.2.1. str = str.trim(); 3.1.3. If str.equals("") then 3.1.3.1. containsEmpty = true; 3.1.3.2. break; 3.2. Else if value is an instance of Collection then 3.2.1. If ((Collection) value).isEmpty() then 3.2.1.1. containsEmpty = true; 3.2.1.2. break; 3.3. Else if value is an instance of Map then 3.3.1. If ((Map) value).isEmpty() then 3.3.1.1. containsEmpty = true; 3.3.1.2. break; 4. If containsEmpty then 4.1. Throw ExceptionHelper.constructException(exceptionClass, name + " should not contain empty values");

参数：
exceptionClass - the exception class
name - the name associated with the value
map - the map to be checked
trimStrings - true if strings should be trimmed before emptiness check, false otherwise
抛出：
T - if the given map contains an empty value (string, collection or map)
T extends java.lang.Throwable

checkGreaterThan

public static <T extends java.lang.Throwable> void checkGreaterThan(double value,
                                                                    double number,
                                                                    boolean inclusive,
                                                                    java.lang.String name,
                                                                    java.lang.Class<T> exceptionClass)
                             throws T extends java.lang.Throwable
Checks whether the given value is greater than (greater than or equal to, if inclusive is true) than the specified number. And if this condition is not met, the specified exception is thrown. Note: Don't forget about "Floating-Point Accuracy/Comparison" problems when checking floating point numbers. Inclusive comparison is recommended to be used with integral types only. Generic Parameters: T - the type of the exception to be thrown when validation fails Parameters: value - the value to be checked number - the number the value should be compared to inclusive - true if "greater than or equal to" check should be performed, false if "greater than" check should be performed name - the name associated with the value exceptionClass - the exception class Throws: T if the given value is not greater than (not greater than and not equal to, if inclusive is true) than the specified number Implementation Notes: 1. If inclusive then 1.1. If value < number then 1.1.1. Throw ExceptionHelper.constructException(exceptionClass, name + " should be greater than or equal to " + number); 2. Else 2.1. If value <= number then 2.1.1. Throw ExceptionHelper.constructException(exceptionClass, name + " should be greater than " + number);

参数：
inclusive - true if "greater than or equal to" check should be performed, false if "greater than" check should be performed
exceptionClass - the exception class
name - the name associated with the value
value - the value to be checked
number - the number the value should be compared to
抛出：
T - if the given value is not greater than (not greater than and not equal to, if inclusive is true) than the specified number
T extends java.lang.Throwable

checkLessThan

public static <T extends java.lang.Throwable> void checkLessThan(double value,
                                                                 double number,
                                                                 boolean inclusive,
                                                                 java.lang.String name,
                                                                 java.lang.Class<T> exceptionClass)
                          throws T extends java.lang.Throwable
Checks whether the given value is less than (less than or equal to, if inclusive is true) than the specified number. And if this condition is not met, the specified exception is thrown. Note: Don't forget about "Floating-Point Accuracy/Comparison" problems when checking floating point numbers. Inclusive comparison is recommended to be used with integral types only. Generic Parameters: T - the type of the exception to be thrown when validation fails Parameters: value - the value to be checked number - the number the value should be compared to inclusive - true if "less than or equal to" check should be performed, false if "less than" check should be performed name - the name associated with the value exceptionClass - the exception class Throws: T if the given value is not less than (not less than and not equal to, if inclusive is true) than the specified number Implementation Notes: 1. If inclusive then 1.1. If value > number then 1.1.1. Throw ExceptionHelper.constructException(exceptionClass, name + " should be less than or equal to " + number); 2. Else 2.1. If value >= number then 2.1.1. Throw ExceptionHelper.constructException(exceptionClass, name + " should be less than " + number);

checkInRange

public static <T extends java.lang.Throwable> void checkInRange(double value,
                                                                double from,
                                                                double to,
                                                                boolean fromInclusive,
                                                                boolean toInclusive,
                                                                java.lang.String name,
                                                                java.lang.Class<T> exceptionClass)
                         throws T extends java.lang.Throwable
Checks whether the given value is in the specified range. And if this condition is not met, the specified exception is thrown. Note: Don't forget about "Floating-Point Accuracy/Comparison" problems when checking floating point numbers. Inclusive comparison is recommended to be used with integral types only. Generic Parameters: T - the type of the exception to be thrown when validation fails Parameters: value - the value to be checked from - the start value of the range to - the end value of the range fromInclusive - true if start value is included into the range, false otherwise toInclusive - true if end value is included into the range, false otherwise name - the name associated with the value exceptionClass - the exception class Throws: T if the given value is out of the specified range Implementation Notes: 1. boolean valid; 2. If fromInclusive then 2.1. valid = (value >= from); 3. Else 3.1. valid = (value > from); 4. If valid then 4.1. If toInclusive then 4.1.1. valid = (value <= to); 4.2. Else 4.2.1. valid = (value < to); 5. If not valid then 5.1. String message = name + " should be in the range " + (fromInclusive ? "[" : "(") + from + ", " + to + (toInclusive ? "]" : ")"); 5.2. Throw ExceptionHelper.constructException(exceptionClass, message).

参数：
to - the end value of the range
exceptionClass - the exception class
fromInclusive - true if start value is included into the range, false otherwise
name - the name associated with the value
value - the value to be checked
toInclusive - true if end value is included into the range, false otherwise
from - the start value of the range
抛出：
T - if the given value is out of the specified range
T extends java.lang.Throwable
